title: Dash board
comment: Used this app easy to display..tq

title: Good
comment: Used to show network name, but suddenly changed to display only speed. Pls advise how to fix, thx.

title: Pretty cool
comment: Says my IP is 0.0.0.0 on wifi networks with IPv6, but generally pretty nice

title: Could use settings menu
comment: If I could choose to show my current network speeds or my network name for the home screen widget that would be awesome

title: Doesn't update consistently
comment: I was out and it showed I was on my home network, and after I got home and was definitely connected it showed no WiFi connection.  And to top it off when I looked this morning instead of showing my wireless connection there was a request for a donation to avoid further messages. That's just cheesy dev. If you want to get paid then make it a paid app, don't call it free and then display these messages.

title: Ongoing Notifications
comment: Redundant and annoying.

title: Good
comment: Like it......I wish it showed WiFi signal strength in % and IP address as well

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent

title: Needs a new classification..
comment: BEGWARE. Seriously, load two of the devs extensions and you get notifications for purchase, for an extension that you're better off buying with a full application such as System Monitor.  Why doesn't the dev just bundle all of them and then charge for basically a redundant and useless extension with limited capability? Do not buy, just because the dev is shameless.
Good

title: Asking to buy
comment: This is telling me I have to pay because I have more than one of his dashclock extensions installed but this is the only one.
R

Developer keeps declining any type of payment and all of my cards work. Needs to update quicker. When I disconnect and reconnect to WiFi it won't pop up until I turn the screen off and back on. Takes a while to update the link speed

title: Found a better extension
comment: Uninstalled due to greedy developer restrictions on additional modules.

title: Meh
comment: lacks  functionalities

title: cant complain
comment: it just works. great plugin for those who remove the status bar from their launcher and want to see the connection info for wifi. it would be nice to see the security and signal strength also not just the connection speed.

title: Not even remotely accurate
comment: The WiFi speed gauges might as well be random. On a 7 Mbps WiFi it says 18 Mbps, while on a 2 Mbps WiFi it says 72 Mbps.

title: Dosnt work
comment: Disappointed that it dosnt work

title: Not showing up

title: Works well
comment: Functions as described here, with no problems. KK (3rd party) Dashclock on ADW launcher/ Samsung Galaxy Exhibit sgh-t599n running KitKat 4.4.2 Omni ROM

title: Wellll....
comment: It always says 72mbps..never says anything else..what's the deal?..plz fix for a better rating.

title: If You Want Money Ask Up Front
comment: I uninstalled all apps and extensions from this developer, because rather than asking to be paid for his work up front, he has his extensions nag you to install an additional paid extension when you are using two or more of them. I have no time for this annoyance.

title: Thanks
comment: Very good

title: Stop
comment: Asking to buy

title: Ripoff
comment: Money, money, all about money, the author of the widget can change for a hefty one, and I will pay, but one extention? Just think about something new, loser.

title: Asking for people to buy
comment: Please stop with the "thank you for using three of my extensions please consider buying......" It totally defeats the purpose of the extension! I can't even use it because of that Big reason to in uninstall

title: Amazing extension
comment: Amazing extension

title: Keep prompting for donation
comment: Either limit the features or don't provide a free version!

title: Random on my phone
comment: Will tell me I'm on a router at work 17 miles away.  Not real dependable...

title: I'm pretty sure my WiFi isn't a constant 150 mbps
comment: Speed test said my WiFi is 21 Mbps on multiple devices and this crap says its 150 mbps

title: Crashes on Android 4.4
comment: Worked fine until the last update. Had to uninstall as it keeps on crashing

title: Poor... Poor...poor...
comment: No reply from devloper..this is pathetic...I have unlock the key by purchasing it...now how can i use it for your wireless extention.......
Come up with request to pay

title: 'Free'
comment: This extension does the job, but don't like the fact I am prompted to make a donation if I have downloaded 2+ apps from the developer to unlock them. Either make them all free, or charge for each one. If they look good and do their job people don't mind paying upfront.

title: Annoyingly desperate
comment: Won't show the info you downloaded the app for after a while demanding payment in exchange.
Nothing but spam. Dont install. He keeps asking you to pay him money. Says if you use an extension that'll go away but it doesn't.

title: Nice; IP missing
comment: hope to get the IP soon! Thank you for this nice widget!

title: I would support this developer...
comment: because these extensions are great, but the harassment needs to stop.

Hi Chris. The reason you are prompted is because you are using multiple extensions of mine. If you simply use one, it does not ever prompt you. Turning the screen off and on also causes the message to disappear. My apologies for any harassment caused. Thank you for your feedback. I would love to hear your suggestions about a less intrusive method.

title: Keeps begging for money
comment: Used to work perfectly. Now this doesn't work and keeps begging for money. I will never support someone who goes back from being free to wanting to charge. Greedy.

title: Great!
comment: I am going to keep this on my dashclock from now on, would give a 5 stars if there was a settings menu to configure things like the unit used to measure the internet speed (specifically megabytes per second)
Worked great until spam messages

title: Sucks
comment: Spam on my lock screen! App deleted in a flash.

title: Battery killer
comment: Latest update is straight murdering my battery life.

title: Doesn't work
comment: Just puts up an annoying message asking for money

title: Ad notification for donation after recent update
comment: I can find other things to do this without being spammed. Removed.

Latest update. Hasn't fixed the need to toggle the power button to enable the app to work	This is only useful as an app if you keep you wireless on all the time. If like me you Mostly use mobile data then it's really annoying as you have to toggle the power switch on the nexus 4 for the widget to display the network. Fix this and I'll happily change my rating.

title: Wake up issue
comment: Good plug in, one issue on a Google Nexus 10 is that after you turn on the device, and wifi  wakes up, the plug in will not pick up on the signal. You need to turn off the power button, once WiFi is established, then turn on again for the plug in to show up.... You should look at DashNet, this works properly, yours does not....  New update - still does not work properly....

title: No Show
comment: Won't show up even in the extension list
